channel.title: Changing an Item's Color

item.title: Changing an Item's Color
item.dc:creator: @Encryptic Encryptic
item.description:
@Encryptic wrote:

Sorry that I have asked quite a few questions as of late. I try to look around before asking, and skim code.

Well, I found in the Client side in my ItemDef_2.java this bit of code that stood out to me.

itemDef.modifiedModelColors = new int[1];
itemDef.originalModelColors = new int[1];
itemDef.modifiedModelColors[0] = 926;
itemDef.originalModelColors[0] = 9583;

The entire bit of code for the item is this…

    case 3272:
        itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
        itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wield";
        itemDef.modifiedModelColors = new int[1];
        itemDef.originalModelColors = new int[1];
        itemDef.modifiedModelColors[0] = 926;
        itemDef.originalModelColors[0] = 9583;
        itemDef.modelid = 2438;
        itemDef.modelZoom = 730;
        itemDef.modelRotationY = 516;
        itemDef.modelRotationX = 0;
        itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0;
        itemDef.modelOffset2 = -10;
        itemDef.anInt165 = 3188;
        itemDef.anInt200 = 3192;
        itemDef.name = "White h'ween mask";
        itemDef.description = "Aaaarrrghhh... I'm a monster.";

break;

Well, I am wondering, is the “modifiedModelcolors” the way I can change the item colour?
And if so, what is it in? Obviously not Hex. Definitely doesn’t look like RGB either.

Read full topic
